title: Javi Robles
text:
José Javier "Javi" Robles Belmonte (born 3 October 2000) is a Spanish <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who plays as a <a href="Midfielder%23Central%20midfielder">central midfielder</a> for <a href="UD%20Almer%C3%ADa">UD Almería</a>.
Club career.
Born in <a href="Almer%C3%ADa">Almería</a>, <a href="Andalusia">Andalusia</a>, Robles joined <a href="Real%20Madrid%20CF">Real Madrid</a>'s <a href="La%20F%C3%A1brica%20%28Real%20Madrid%29">La Fábrica</a> in 2015, from <a href="UD%20Almer%C3%ADa">UD Almería</a>. He returned to his previous club in 2017, and made his senior debut with <a href="UD%20Almer%C3%ADa%20B">the reserves</a> on 12 May 2019, starting and being <a href="Ejection%20%28sports%29">sent off</a> in a 0–2 <a href="Segunda%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20B">Segunda División B</a> away loss against <a href="CD%20El%20Ejido">CD El Ejido</a>.
Robles scored his first senior goal on 1 November 2019, netting the equalizer in a 1–1 home draw against <a href="CD%20Hu%C3%A9tor%20T%C3%A1jar">CD Huétor Tájar</a> for the <a href="Tercera%20Divisi%C3%B3n">Tercera División</a> championship. He made his first team debut on 16 August 2021, coming on as a late <a href="Substitute%20%28association%20football%29">substitute</a> for <a href="Lucas%20Robertone">Lucas Robertone</a> in a 3–1 <a href="Segunda%20Divisi%C3%B3n">Segunda División</a> away win against <a href="FC%20Cartagena">FC Cartagena</a>.
